list.name: Changes
list.comment: Enhancements: - Added CLI-based option for users to input a custom date range for earthquake probability forecasts. - Default fallback to the next 10 years if no range is given. - Commented out the secondary visualization that highlights days with probability > 0.65 to simplify output. - Added detailed PEP8-compliant inline comments for better readability and maintainability.

task.summary:
This initial version implements a machine learning application that predicts the probability of earthquakes in Turkey based on planetary positions.
Key features: - Loads and filters earthquake data (CSV format) for Turkey (magnitude ≥ 5). - Computes planetary positions using the Skyfield library for any given date. - Trains a Random Forest model on historical planetary configurations. - Predicts earthquake probabilities for the next 10 years from today. - Displays a matplotlib line chart of probabilities over time. - Annotates peak probability dates over 0.8 for easy visual inspection.
Dependencies: pandas, numpy, skyfield, scikit-learn, joblib, matplotlib, tqdm
Automatically trains and predicts when executed.

Enhancements: - Added CLI-based option for users to input a custom date range for earthquake probability forecasts. - Default fallback to the next 10 years if no range is given. - Commented out the secondary visualization that highlights days with probability > 0.65 to simplify output. - Added detailed PEP8-compliant inline comments for better readability and maintainability.
